title: Rambles in Europe in 1839. With sketches of prominent surgeons, physicians, medical schools, hospitals, literary personages, scenery, etc
author: Gibson, William
snippet: Yet time waspressing, and a glorious prospect still lay before me—thefascination of which I felt it would be impossible long toresist. I returned, therefore, to Melrose, revisited theold Abbey, mounted the top of a coach, on a clear sunnymorning, and passing, from right to left, in varied succession, the beautiful streams and vales of the Allan, theTweed, and Gala water, the seats and towers of thePavilion, Langlee House, Galashiels, Torwoodlie, Crookston, Bowland, Arnislon, Bothwick and Dalhousie Castles,Newbattle Abbey, Hawthornden, Melville Castle, Eldin andRoslin, catching, ever and anon, splendid glimpses of thePentland Hills, of Arthur's Seat, of the Firth of Forth,entered the Queen of the North," Edina, Scotia's darlingseat," after a delightful ride of six-and-thirty miles.
